Returns: a pending result containing the requested session and data. Includes a data set for each session and data type that was returned.
Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. It does not need to be connected at the time of this call, but the insertion will be delayed until the connection is complete.
a built request specifying the specific session, time interval and/or data type for the query
readSession(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Reads data from the user's Google Fit store of the specific type(s) and for the specific session(s) selected from the request parameters.
readSession(com.google.android.gms.commo.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<SessionReadResult> readSession (GoogleApiClient client, SessionReadRequest request)

Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. Must be connected at the time of this call.
a callback intent to be sent every time a session is started or stopped.
registerForSessions(com.google.android.g.Description: Registers for notifications of session start and end events using a PendingIntent. The application specifies a PendingIntent callback (typically an IntentService) which will be called when sessions are started or stopped. When the PendingIntent is called, the application can use @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Session#extract_E@ to extract the Session from the intent. In addition, the following Intent extras can be used: @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#Fitness#EXTRA_START_TIME_E@ set to the Session's start time. @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#Fitness#EXTRA_END_TIME_E@ optionally set to the Session's end time if the session has ended. Finally, the Intent's type will be set to @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#FitnessActivities#getMimeType_E@. Any previously registered sessions that have the same PendingIntent (as defined by @B_android#app#PendingIntent#equals_E@) will be replaced by this session.
registerForSessions(com.google.android.g.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> registerForSessions (GoogleApiClient client, PendingIntent intent)

Returns: a pending result containing the list of sessions that were stopped
Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. Must be connected at the time of this call.
the identifier of the session to stop. If null is passed all active sessions will be stopped.
stopSession(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Stops active sessions for the current application. The active sessions to be stopped are chosen as per the specifications in the input request.
stopSession(com.google.android.gms.commo.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<SessionStopResult> stopSession (GoogleApiClient client, String identifier)

Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. Must be connected at the time of this call.
the PendingIntent that was used in the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#registerForSessions_E@ call or is equal as defined by @B_android#app#PendingIntent#equals_E@.
unregisterForSessions(com.google.android.Description: Unregisters from session start and end notifications using a @B_android#app#PendingIntent_E@.
unregisterForSessions(com.google.android.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> unregisterForSessions (GoogleApiClient client, PendingIntent intent)

Returns: a pending result containing the status of request
Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. Must be connected at the time of this call.
startSession(com.google.android.gms.comm.Description: Starts a new active session for the current application.
startSession(com.google.android.gms.comm.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> startSession (GoogleApiClient client, Session session)

Parameters: an existing GoogleApiClient. It does not need to be connected at the time of this call, but the insertion will be delayed until the connection is complete.
the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Session_E@ and its associated data, which includes details of the session and data set for data source(s).
insertSession(com.google.android.gms.com.Description: Inserts specified @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Session_E@ and corresponding data into the user's Google Fit store on behalf of the current application. Useful for bulk upload of a previously recorded session.
insertSession(com.google.android.gms.com.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> insertSession (GoogleApiClient client, SessionInsertRequest request)

ClassDesc: API for creating and managing @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Session_E@ of user activity in Google Fit. Sessions are a way of storing user-visible groups of related stream data in a useful and shareable manner, and allow for easy querying of the data in a detailed or aggregated fashion. The @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#startSession_E@ and @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#stopSession_E@ methods mark the time range of the session. Data inserted using the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#HistoryApi_E@ during the period where the session is in progress will be associated with that Session once it is stopped. Another way of adding sessions is with @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#insertSession_E@. This is designed for bulk insertion when importing a user's historic data into Google Fit; for live sessions use the previous API. All data in Google Fit that falls within the time range of an inserted session will be implicitly associated with that session. Once a session has been saved, it can be retrieved using @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#readSession_E@. Clients can register to be notified of sessions, and remove existing registrations, using @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#registerForSessions_E@ and @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#SessionsApi#unregisterForSessions_E@. Notifications will be sent for sessions when they are started and stopped. Deleting sessions is handled like any other data deletion, via @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#HistoryApi#deleteData_E@. The Sessions API should be accessed via the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#Fitness_E@ entry point. Example:
